channel.title: Landscape Editor Project(2)
channel.description:
Seems we had a little rollback, anyhow, the previous project is out the window. Here's the new approach I'm taking with it. I've chosen a new path that involves more direct communication with the system's video hardware that loads about 50x faster than the GDI+ methods. Sexy, no?
http://photoserver.ws/images/6RB64b15abe3d0583.gif
Comments, suggestions are appreciated.

item.title: Landscape Editor Project(2)
item.dc:creator: @Zilent Zilent
item.description:
@Zilent wrote:

Hi xEnt,

You might find it odd, but I use VB.NET as my main pseudo-coding language because of how fast prototypes can be developed with it. I’ll be recoding it in C++ when I iron out the camera mathematics and texture mapping with DirectX. I’m getting about 45 frames per second on a PC equipped with a 2.53GHz Celeron with 512mB ram. Hopefully after the semester ends I’ll have more than a half hour a day to work on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape Editor Project(2)
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

it’s a better approach to go 3D due to the elevation of tiles, but i don’t think the hardware acceleration is necessary if it’s going to be event driven. When i was messing around with the Java3D library i rendered the same amount of polygons of not more at about 20fps a second without hardware acceleration, then again my computers is high end.

I don’t know if you saw my reply to your old post, but i said something like, inside the landscape editor that me,vrunk & peeter put together in the bottom of the Util class there is a Color array of size 256 containing the rgb of the tile (index of the color is the tiles color value when reading the bytes)

also out of curiosity which .NET language?

Read full topic
